title: generated song sparks curiosity and debate after topping country music charts

title: Cities and states are turning to AI to improve road safety

title: Ethical risks of blind trust in artificial intelligence
description: Voice assistants, social robots, and chatbots are now engineered to mimic empathy and warmth. Research shows that users respond to these cues as they would to human interactions, developing a sense of rapport or emotional attachment. However, this response arises from psychological reflexes, not rational evaluation. A digital assistant that says “I’m sorry” after an error may appear responsible, but such gestures are performative, not ethical.
content: A leading AI philosopher has issued a sharp warning against one of the most common assumptions in artificial intelligence ethics, that the goal of developers should be to make users trust AI systems. In a new paper, Dr. Giacomo Zanotti of Politecnico... [8748 chars]

title: Google announces $40 billion Texas investment to expand AI
